name: Chateau Louis Hotel & Conference Centre

reviews.text: Was in town two night for a reunion just up the street at the Aviation Museum-a previous stay at the Ramada across the road last December was much less than impressive, so decided to give Chateau Louis a try. Five minute walk from my venue.
reviews.title: Great value

likes.disliked: — mix up on check in-accn was very tight in Edmonton that weekend

reviews.text: For about $100 not expecting much, but ended up in one of their newly redecorated rooms which was very very nice, easily worth double the price in a more upscale (namewise ) property. They have dispensed with tradational dressers etc and installed a wall of built in cabinets featuring large LCD TV, bar sink, granite countertop etc. Bathroom totally updated as well. Only real hiccup was fact my reservation reversed my names, but that was quickly striaghtened out.
reviews.title: Terribly disappointing

reviews.text: If you are looking for a four star property with all the bells and whistles, this is not the place for you-try the Marriott or Westin, but for good solid value at a budget price I was very impressed.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

likes.disliked: — The gas fireplace was a little loud.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price also included a good hot breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the stay!

likes.disliked: — Parking lot is not quite big enough.

reviews.text: My daughter stayed there with her cadet group for a competition being held at the Jefferson Armories. I was very disappointed to find out that the room had smelled like smoke and that they actually had to empty an ashtray when they first got to the room. They did not feel comfortable and were treated like a nuisance (the entire group of kids). If a hotel is not prepared to have kids (teenagers) as guests then they should not take them as guests. There were also reports back that the room was dingy and filthy. I am very disappointed and feel sick that her weekend consisted of breathing someone else's second hand smoke.
reviews.title: very good stay

reviews.text: I had to stay here for 4 nights as I had training for my job at a nearby clinic. I thought that the outside was nice...on the website picture. The room is rather dated with stained furniture and a super small bathroom. The gym was ok except my room key didnt work to get in there as well as the ones they gave me. The free breakfast was great! Fresh fruit and plenty of options. Not too amused that every morning I ate there the waitress went around and offered everyone else coffee except for me and got to me as I was about to leave. I resulted to giving myself a sponge bath as the shower not only was low-flow but was fine at one point, then scalding hot then ice cold! Another thing I was annoyed about was the fact that I specifically left the "privacy please" sign in the door everyday I would leave for work to find that my room was done up and every day I would call the front desk to complain. If I have to be flown up here again, I'm requesting to stay at another hotel.
reviews.title: It was....Meh!

likes.liked: — The free breakfast minus the wait staff
likes.disliked: — the ever changing temperature of the shower

reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, convenient
reviews.text: I have stayed here two times in the past month.

reviews.title: On the way to improvement
reviews.text: First stay was for 4 nights as I was taking a couple of courses at NAIT. I emailed the hotel and got a great rate for the basic Queen. I was unsure what to expect with the rooms but for the rate I was just expecting a bed and something convenient to school.

When I checked in she offered me the next room up, a renovated Queen for $10 extra, and also the King for $25 extra. I asked if I could look at the standard plus the renovated room. The renovated room was on the 1st floor and fairly close to reception, so as I was traveling alone I decided to take that. It was clean, well sized, newer bathroom with bath curtain, two sinks, good amenities. I then took a walk upstairs to look at the standard room and it too was clean, same size room, but slightly smaller bathroom, and an older tub with sliding doors. It would have been fine but I decided to stay in the deluxe room.
reviews.title: They never cleaned between guests

reviews.text: The hotel itself is clean, housekeeping and check-in staff are friendly. Breakfast is included but as I had early classes I was not able to enjoy it except for one weekend day. There was a range of hot food, fruits, juice, cereal, etc. Complimentary newspapers are available and Internet access is also included.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel .........

aka: Chateau Louis Hotel And Conference Centre
description: European style boutique hotel with a French Provincial theme centrally located across from City Centre Airport, near the heart of downtown Edmonton. 140 room full service hotel with Royal Coach Dining Room, Julian's Piano Bar and Touch of Class Gaming Room. Free-standing Conference Centre with twelve banquet and meeting rooms. Family, Accessible and Jacuzzi Rooms & Suites. No charge wireless and high speed internet access, parking and in-room coffee. Complimentary Full Hot Breakfast Buffet.
